skill.name: paper-2-web
skill.description: This skill should be used when converting academic papers into promotional and presentation formats including interactive websites (Paper2Web), presentation videos (Paper2Video), and conference posters (Paper2Poster). Use this skill for tasks involving paper dissemination, conference preparation, creating explorable academic homepages, generating video abstracts, or producing print-ready posters from LaTeX or PDF sources.
skill.summary: This skill should be used when converting academic papers into promotional and presentation formats ...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation files with no executable code. It serves as a wrapper for the external Paper2All tool, providing guidance for users to manually install and run the tool. No file system access, network calls, or code execution capabilities exist within the skill itself.

content.user_title: Transform papers into websites, videos, and posters
content.value_statement: Academic papers require extensive work to convert into promotional materials. This skill automates the transformation of LaTeX or PDF papers into interactive websites, presentation videos, and conference posters using AI-powered content extraction and design generation.
actual_capabilities: Convert LaTeX or PDF papers into interactive academic websites
Generate professional presentation videos with narration and slides
Create print-ready conference posters with custom dimensions
Extract and structure paper content for multiple output formats
Apply automatic branding and logo discovery using Google Search API
Process multiple papers in batch for efficient workflows
limitations: Requires external Paper2All tool installation (not bundled)
LaTeX source provides better results than PDF input
Complex mathematical equations may require manual review
GPU resources required for talking-head video generation

use_cases.title: Conference presentation package
use_cases.description: Generate website, poster, and video for NeurIPS or major conference submissions

use_cases.title: Preprint enhancement
use_cases.description: Create interactive homepages for bioRxiv or arXiv submissions to increase visibility

use_cases.title: Batch paper promotion
use_cases.description: Process multiple papers from your research group for annual reviews or websites

prompt_templates.title: Basic Website
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert my LaTeX paper at [path/to/paper] into an interactive academic website. Use GPT-4 for content generation. Enable logo search for institution branding.

prompt_templates.title: Full Conference Package
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a complete conference package for my paper including a 4x3 foot poster, 15-minute presentation video, and interactive website. Use LaTeX source at [path].

prompt_templates.title: Video Abstract
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a 5-minute video abstract from my Nature Communications paper. Focus on key findings and visual results. Use GPT-4.1 for script generation.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Paper Batch
prompt_templates.prompt: Process all 5 papers in [batch_input/] directory. Generate websites for each paper. Enable logo search and use consistent branding across all outputs.

output_examples.input: Convert my CVPR paper to a website, poster, and video presentation
output: Interactive website with responsive layout, navigation, and embedded figures
4'x3' print-ready conference poster in PDF format at 300 DPI
15-minute narrated presentation video with synchronized slides
All outputs organized in output/[paper_name]/ subdirectories

best_practices: Use LaTeX source with all assets (figures, bibliography) for best content extraction
Enable logo search to automatically discover and add institution branding
Start with website generation (fastest) then add poster and video components
Review all outputs before submission for accuracy and readability
anti_patterns: Using low-resolution figures (below 300 DPI) which degrade output quality
Processing very long papers (>50 pages) without content prioritization
Skipping quality review before conference deadlines
Generating video with talking-head without sufficient GPU memory (48GB minimum)

faq.question: What input formats are supported?
faq.answer: LaTeX source with main.tex and all assets is recommended. PDF with selectable text is also accepted. LaTeX provides better structure extraction.

faq.question: What are the processing time estimates?
faq.answer: Website takes 15-30 minutes, poster 10-20 minutes, video 20-60 minutes. Video with talking-head requires 60-120 minutes on 48GB GPU.

faq.question: Can this skill be combined with other skills?
faq.answer: Yes. Pair with scientific-schematics for publication-quality diagrams, or AutoPR for promotional social media content generation.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: This skill only provides documentation. The external Paper2All tool sends content to OpenAI API for processing. Review API provider data policies.

faq.question: Why is the generated video failing to render?
faq.answer: Check that LibreOffice and Poppler utilities are installed. Verify 5GB+ disk space. Review error logs in output directory. Ensure GPU memory for talking-head.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual creation tools?
faq.answer: This skill automates content extraction and layout generation. Manual tools (PowerPoint, Canva) offer more control but require significant time investment.
